item.title: 【Containerized Intelligence: Running LLMs at Scale Using Docker and Kubernetes】集装箱智能：使用Docker和Kubernetes大规模运行LLMS
item.description:
【

Large Language Models (LLMs) such as GPT, LLaMA, and Mistral have transformed the way applications interpret and generate natural language, driving innovation across a wide range of industries. Yet, operationalizing these models at scale introduces a host of technical challenges, including dependency management, GPU integration, orchestration, and auto-scaling.

The rapid evolution of LLMs presents immense opportunities for building intelligent, language-aware applications. However, deploying and managing these compute-intensive models in production environments requires a reliable and scalable infrastructure. This is where containerization with Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes come into play—offering a powerful combination to streamline LLM deployment, ensure reproducibility, and support horizontal scaling.

】

Large Language Models (LLMs) such as GPT, LLaMA, and Mistral have transformed the way applications interpret and generate natural language, driving innovation across a wide range of industries.然而，大规模运营这些模型会引入许多技术挑战，包括依赖性管理，GPU集成，编排和自动规模。

LLMS的快速发展为构建智能，语言意识的应用提供了巨大的机会。但是，在生产环境中部署和管理这些计算密集型模型需要可靠且可扩展的基础架构。在这里，使用 docker 和 kubernetes LLM部署，确保可重复性并支持水平缩放。

item.title: 【Talk to Your BigQuery Data Using Claude Desktop】使用Claude Desktop与您的BigQuery数据交谈

Before we get into the nitty-gritty details of how it is done, let us first look at a simple diagram explaining how we can connect and talk to our BigQuery data using natural language via MCP. We will then talk about each of the components and how they are set up, and then we will look at how the whole thing works.

item.title: 【Not only AI: What Else Drives Team Performance Today?】不仅是AI：还有什么驱动今天的团队表现？
item.description:
【

Today’s world is obsessed with AI, and performance conversations often center on models, automation, and tooling. But when it comes to real, sustainable productivity gains, it’s not just about adding more AI. It's about designing better systems. In high-speed product environments (whether driven by AI or not) execution is urgent, but effectiveness depends on how you enable people.

At GlobalLogic, I joined an early-stage GenAI product team. The stakes were high, timelines were tight, and yet, within three months, we boosted team performance by 20%. But we didn’t get there by chasing every shiny AI solution. We got there by doing the basics right: building clarity, creating smart feedback loops, and empowering decision-makers.

】

当今世界对AI着迷，性能对话通常以模型，自动化和工具为中心。但是，当涉及到真实，可持续的生产力提高时，这不仅仅是添加更多的AI。这是关于设计更好的系统。在高速产品环境（无论是否由AI驱动）中，执行是紧迫的，但有效性取决于您如何使人。

在Globallogic上，我加入了一个早期 genai 产品团队。赌注很高，时间表很紧，但是在三个月内，我们将团队绩效提高了20％。但是我们没有通过追逐所有闪亮的AI解决方案来到那里。我们通过正确的基础来到达那里：建立清晰度，创建智能反馈循环并赋予决策者权力。

item.title: 【MCP Client-Server Integration With Semantic Kernel】MCP客户端服务器与语义内核集成
item.description:
【

Modern AI applications gain real popularity when they translate natural language prompts to execute external services. This article describes the basic understanding of the key components: semantic kernel, Azure OpenAI, and MCP Client-Server. It also describes the implementation to connect the Semantic Kernel to an Azure-hosted OpenAI resource so that an LLM can be queried directly. 

Additionally, you will learn how to create an MCP Client, run the MCP Server, and expose the MCP tools. The tools that are discovered can then be registered as kernel functions in the Semantic Kernel and thus, augment the LLM with the ability to execute external tools as a Service that are provided through the MCP Server.

】

现代AI应用程序翻译自然语言提示执行外部服务时，它们就会获得真正的知名度。本文介绍了关键组件的基本理解：语义内核，Azure OpenAI和MCP客户端服务器。它还描述了将语义内核连接到Azure托管的OpenAI资源的实现，以便可以直接查询LLM。 

此外，您将学习如何创建 mcp client ，运行MCP服务器，并曝光MCP工具。然后，发现的工具可以在语义内核中注册为内核函数，因此可以通过MCP服务器提供的外部工具来增加LLM的LLM。

item.title: 【Getting Started With PyIceberg: A Pythonic Approach to Managing Apache Iceberg Tables】Pyiceberg入门：一种管理Apache Iceberg桌子的Pythonic方法
item.description:
【

Modern data platforms are evolving rapidly—driven by a need for scalability, flexibility, and analytics at scale. Lakehouse architecture sits at the center of this evolution, combining the low-cost storage of data lakes with the reliability and structure of data warehouses.

To power these lakehouses, organizations are turning to open table formats like Apache Iceberg. Originally developed at Netflix, Apache Iceberg was built to manage petabyte-scale analytics in cloud object storage. It brings database-style features—ACID transactions, schema evolution, partition pruning, and time travel—to large-scale files stored in systems like Amazon S3 or Azure Data Lake.

】

现代数据平台正在迅速发展，这是由于对可伸缩性，灵活性和分析的需求驱动。 Lakehouse建筑位于此演变的中心，将数据湖的低成本存储与数据仓库的可靠性和结构相结合。

为这些 lakehouses Apache Iceberg最初是在Netflix开发的，旨在管理Cloud Object Storage中的Petabyte尺度分析。它带来了数据库风格的功能 - 酸交易，架构进化，分区修剪和时间旅行 - 在像Amazon S3或Azure数据湖等系统中存储的大型文件。

item.title: 【Prompt Engineering Wasn't Enough; Context Engineering Is What Came Next】及时的工程还不够。上下文工程是接下来的
item.description:
【

Over the last few years, the conversation around AI has slowly shifted from prompt engineering to something more structured and more powerful: context engineering. 

When you are working on a chatbot that answers questions around a knowledge base or working on an agentic AI framework that is very complex, the way you architect context depends entirely on the problem you are solving. Simply put, context complexity scales with the task uncertainty. Simple, predictable tasks require minimal context structuring, while complex, multi-step tasks require sophisticated context orchestration.

】

在过去的几年中，围绕AI的对话已逐渐从及时的工程转变为更具结构化和更强大的东西：上下文工程。 

当您处理聊天机器人时，该聊天机器人围绕知识库回答问题或处理非常复杂的代理AI框架时，您的架构架构上下文的方式完全取决于您正在解决的问题。简而言之，与任务不确定性相关的上下文复杂性尺度。简单，可预测的任务需要最小的上下文结构，而复杂的多步任务需要复杂的上下文编排。

item.title: 【Bridging the Gap: Integrating Graphic Design Principles into Front-End Development】弥合差距：将图形设计原理整合到前端开发中
item.description:

The line between design and development is becoming increasingly blurred. Websites and applications no longer compete solely based on functionality—they must also deliver intuitive, visually appealing user experiences. For front-end developers, understanding and applying basic graphic design principles is no longer a luxury but a necessity. This blog explores how developers can harness design fundamentals to create beautiful, effective user interfaces that not only function well but also delight users.

Traditionally, the design and development worlds were siloed. Designers handled aesthetics, while developers focused on code. But as agile workflows, collaborative tools, and lean UX practices became the norm, the need for developers to be visually literate grew.

item.title: 【Amadeus Cloud Migration on Ampere Altra Instances】Amadeus云迁移在Ampere Altra实例上
item.description:
【

“You might not be familiar with Amadeus, because it is a B2B company [but] when you search for a flight or a hotel on the Internet, there is a good chance that you are using an Amadeus-powered service behind the scenes,” according to Didier Spezia, a cloud architect for Amadeus. Amadeus is a leading global travel IT company, powering the activities of many actors in the travel industry: airlines, hotel chains, travel agencies, airports, among others. 

One of Amadeus’ activities is to provide shopping services to search and price flights for travel agencies and companies like Kayak or Expedia. Amadeus also supports more advanced capabilities, such as budget-driven queries and calendar-constrained queries, which require pre-calculating multi-dimensional indexes. Searching for suitable flights with available seats among many airlines is surprisingly difficult.

】

“您可能不熟悉Amadeus，因为它是一家B2B公司[但是]当您在互联网上搜索航班或酒店时，您很有可能在幕后使用Amadeus驱动的服务，” Didier Spezia表示，Amadeus的云建筑师Didier Spezia说。 Amadeus是一家领先的全球旅行IT公司，为许多演出行业中的许多演员的活动提供动力：航空公司，酒店连锁店，旅行社，机场等。 

Amadeus的一项活动是为旅行社和像皮划艇或Expedia等公司的搜索和价格航班提供购物服务。 Amadeus还支持更高级的功能，例如预算驱动的查询和日历约束的查询，这些查询需要预先计算的多维指数。在许多航空公司中搜索合适的航班带有可用座位的航班非常困难。
